Jazakallah for writing on behalf of your friends.%0D%0A%0D%0AIt would appear that your friends are planning their future without the advice of their parents, elders or proper medical advice. I wish to point out that it is unacceptable for non-mahram girls and boys to discuss such intimate details with each other. As long as they are not married, both of them have an obligation to each other to protect each other's modesty and they have to obey Allah Ta'ala's commandments about intermingling between the sexes. This is not a trivial matter and they should take heed urgently%0D%0A%0D%0AI strongly suggest that this young man should speak to his elders and tell them about his sexual inadequacy. He should also seek the advice of a medical expert. It may be that his condition is treatable or reversable but by delaying to get expert couselling the delay may go become irreversible.%0D%0A%0D%0AThe young lady has to consider many aspects before she agrees to marrying him. "Love' before marriage is not tangible and for real. Once a woman is married, she becomes 'broody' and her desire for children increases. If she is unable to conceive children due to a problem in the man, she may resent him and fail to derive emotional comfort from the marriage. She should give serious thought to this situation and seek counselling before she finally makes up her mind. I urge caution and much thought on both sides before a final decision is made on both sides. %0D%0A%0D%0AAnd Allah Ta'ala knows best.%0D%0A%0D%0A1Social department%0D%0A%0D%0ACHECKED & APPROVED: Mufti Ebrahim Desai
